table.title: SPI0 Flash 66MHz and 100MHz 2-Load Branch (PCH.IOE to Flash and TPM) MAF Topology Notes

entry.p: Require additional isolation circuitry to protect CPU from back-feed voltage when connect to flash programmer.
To be placed within 12.7 mm from flash device on SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.
To be placed within 12.7 mm from flash device on SPI0_CLK.
To be placed within 5.08 mm from the branch on SPI0_CLK, SPI0_MISO, SPI0_MOSI, SPI0_IO2 and SPI0_IO3.
Interleave 1 CS with every 2 DATA lanes is recommended.
Recommend to route DATA and CLK on same layer.
Flash device electrical characteristics recommendation for 100 MHz and 66 MHz support
[1] Driver strength spec: 50 Ω or stronger across worse case corners.
[2] 0.4 ns ≤ rise/ fall time measured at 30% to 70% ≤ 2 ns based on 30 pF test load.
[3] Output capacitance, Cout ≤ 16 pF (including RPMC die).
[4] Input capacitance, Cin ≤ 12 pF (including RPMC die).
[7] CLK to DATA output valid time, min: 1 ns, based on 30 pF test load.
[8] CLK to DATA output valid time, max: 6 ns (50% to 50%), based on 30 pF test load.
